jchrest.domainSpecifics.chess.fixations

Class AttackDefenseFixation

  • java.lang.Object
    • jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation
      • jchrest.domainSpecifics.chess.fixations.AttackDefenseFixation

  • public class AttackDefenseFixation
extends Fixation
    Represents the type of jchrest.lib.Fixation made using the "attack-defense" chess heuristic (see "Perception and Memory in Chess" by de Groot and Gobet, section 8.7.6). NOTE: AttackDefenseFixations require a Fixation focused on a Square containing a non-blind and non-empty SceneObject to have been added by the Perceiver associated with the Chrest model that invokes #this#make(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int) to have been added prior to this invocation to propose a Square to fixate on.

      Square make(Scene scene, int time)
      This method should not be invoked directly to make #this since it will not be guaranteed that the instance variables of #this pertaining to its performance will be set by the concrete implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttackDefenseFixation

        public AttackDefenseFixation(Chrest model,
                             ChessBoard board,
                             int timeThatDecidingUponThisStarts)
        Constructor. Initially sets the time that #this will be decided upon to be the time specified. The constructor will then retrieve the most recent Fixation performed. If this retrieval is successful, the chess piece fixated on is determined and used to generate potential Squares to make #this on. If there are suitable Squares to make #this on in context of the board specified, one is randomly selected and assigned to be the Square to return when #this#make(jchrest.lib.Scene, int) is invoked and the time #this is decided upon is updated to the time specified plus the value of the model specified's Chrest.getTimeToAccessVisualSpatialField() value plus the value of the model specified's Chrest.getTimeToMoveVisualSpatialFieldObject() multiplied by the number of Squares considered for movement to by the chess piece fixated on. Thus, the constructor sets the time #this is decided upon according to the values for the "Base time to generate a move" and "Time to traverse a square" entries in table 8.2 found in "Perception and Memory in Chess" by de Groot and Gobet).
        Parameters:
        model -
        board -
        timeThatDecidingUponThisStarts - The time (in milliseconds) that it will be in the domain when #this starts to be decided upon.

    • Method Detail

      • make

        public Square make(Scene scene,
                   int time)
        Description copied from class: Fixation
        This method should not be invoked directly to make #this since it will not be guaranteed that the instance variables of #this pertaining to its performance will be set by the concrete implementation. Neither can it be guaranteed that the jchrest.lib.Scene that #this is made in context of is the jchrest.lib.Scene that previous Fixations in the same set have been made in context of. Use #this#perform(jchrest.lib.Scene, int) instead.
        Specified by:
        make in class Fixation
        Parameters:
        scene -
        time -
        Returns:
        The Square decided upon when #this#AttackDefenseFixation(jchrest.architecture.Chrest, jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int) was invoked or {@code null} if any of the following conditions evaluate to {@link java.lang.Boolean#TRUE}:
        • The result of {@link #this#getPerformanceTime()} is greater than (later than) the {@code time} specified.
        • {@link java.lang.Boolean#TRUE} is returned when {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene#isBlind()} is invoked in context of the {@code scene} specified.
        • {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene#equals(java.lang.Object)} returns {@link java.lang.Boolean#FALSE} when the {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.chess.ChessBoard} that was used to generate the {@link jchrest.lib.Square} to fixate upon in {@link #this#AttackDefenseFixation(jchrest.architecture.Chrest, jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int)} is compared with the {@code scene} specified.
        • No {@link jchrest.lib.Square} was suitable when {@link #this#AttackDefenseFixation(jchrest.architecture.Chrest, jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int)} was called, i.e. the {@link jchrest.lib.Square} to fixate on is equal to {@code null}.
        • The {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.SceneObject} on the {@link jchrest.lib.Square} to fixate on indicates a blind {@link jchrest.lib.Square} in context of the {@code scene} specified.
